body:
Perhaps leave these comments (and the ones above) unchanged?
I'm thinking that the type-system of a Tensor should always refer to the `DataType` (i.e., the return value of `Tensor.dataType()`). So, this does return the value in a scalar `DataType#FLOAT` tensor, and something like `Tensor<Float>` or `Tensor<TFFloat>` has a "type" of `DataType.FLOAT`.

Does that sound sensible? Separating the "type of the tensor" (from the TensorFlow type system) from the "type parameter" of the class.
